englishNarrator: Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: There passed a bier (being carried by people) and it was lauded in good terms. Upon this the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: It has become certain, it has become certain, it has become certain. And there passed a bier and it was condemned in bad words. Upon this the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: It has become certain, it has become certain, it has become certain. 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: May my father and mother be ransom for you! There passed a bier and it was praised in good terms, and you said: It has become certain, it has become certain, it has become certain. And there passed a bier and it was condemned in bad words, and you said: It has become certain, it has become certain, it has become certain. Upon this the Messenger of Allah (way peace be upon him) said: He whom you praised in good terms, Paradise has become certain for him, and he whom you condemned in bad words, Hell has become certain for him. You are Allah's witnesses in the earth, you are Allah's witnesses in the earth, you are Allah's witnesses in the earth.

englishNarrator: It was narrated that Anas said:
hadithEnglish: "A funeral passed by the Messenger of Allah ﷺ..." and he narrated a hadith similar to that of Abdul Aziz is more complete.

englishNarrator: Qatada bin Rib'i رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: Whenever a bier passed before him, he said: He is the one to find relief and the one with (the departure of him) other will find relief. They said: Apostle of Allah, who is al-Mustarih and al-Mustarah? Upon this he said: The believing servant finds relief from the troubles of the world, and in the death of a wicked person, the people, towns, trees and animals find rellef.

englishNarrator: In the hadith transmitted by Yahya bin Sa'id on the authority of Qatada (the words are):
hadithEnglish: (The believing servant) finds relief from the troubles of the world and its hardships and (gets into) the Mercy of Allah.

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) gave the people news of the death of Negus on the day he died, and he took them out to the place of prayer and observed four takbirs.

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) gave us the news of the death of Negus, the ruler of Abyssinia, on the day when he died, and he said (to us): Beg pardon for your brother. Ibn Shihab said that Sa'id bin Musayyib had told that Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ had narrated to him that the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) drew them up in a row in a place of prayer, and offered prayer and recited four takbirs for him.
This hadith is narrated through another chain of transmitters.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) offered prayer for Ashama, the Negus, and recited four takbirs.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: There died today the pious servant of Allah, Ashama. So he stood up and led us in (funeral prayer) over him.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: A brother of yours has died, so stand up and offer prayer over him. So we stood up and drew ourselves up into two rows.

englishNarrator: Imran bin Husain رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: A brother of yours has died; so stand up and offer prayer for him, i. e. Negus. And in the hadith transmitted by Zuhair (the words are): Your brother.

englishNarrator: Sha'bi reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) observed prayer over a grave after the dead was buried and he recited four takbirs over him. Shaibani said: I said to Sha'bi: Who narrated it to you? He said: An authentic one, 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ . This is the word of a hasan hadith. In the narration of Ibn Numair (the words are): The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) went to the grave which had been newly prepared and prayed over it, and they also prayed who were behind him and he recited four takbirs. I said to 'Amir: Who narrated it to you? He said: An authentic one who saw him, i e. Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ .

englishNarrator: A similar report (as no. 2211) was narrated from Ash-Shab'i fromm Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ, from the prophet ﷺ, but it does not say in the Hadith of any of them:
hadithEnglish: The prophet ﷺ said the Takbir four times.

A hadith similar to that of Ash-Shabi (no.2011), from Ibn Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ , from the prophet ﷺ, concerning his prayer at the graveside but it does not say in their Hadith that he ﷺ said the Takbir four times.

englishNarrator: Anas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) observed prayer on the grave.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of Abu Huraira رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: A dark-complexioned woman (or a youth) used to sweep the mosque. The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) missed her (or him) and inquired about her (or him). The people told him that she (or he) had died. He asked why they did not inform him, and it appears as if they had treated her (or him) or her (or his) affairs as of little account. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Lead me to her (or his) grave. They led him to that place and he said prayer over her (or him) and then remarked: Verily, these graves are full of darkness for their dwellers. Verily, the Mighty and Glorious Allah illuminates them for their occupants by reason of my prayer over them.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of 'Abdul-Rahman bin Abu Laila:
hadithEnglish: Zaid رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ used to recite four takbirs on our funerals and he recited five takbirs on one funeral. I asked him the reason (for this variation), to which he replied: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) recited thus.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of 'Amir Ibn Rabi'a ( رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: Whenever you see a funeral procession, stand up for that until it moves away or is lowered on the ground.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of 'Amir ibn Rabi'a (رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ):
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: Should any one of you come across a funeral procession, and if he does not intend to accompany it, he must stand up until it passes by him or is placed upon the ground before it passes him.

englishNarrator: It is reported on the authority of Ibn Juraij:
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: Should anyone amongst you see a bier he must stand up so long as it is within sight in case he does not intend to follow it.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: When you follow a bier, do not sit until it is placed on the (ground).

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: Whenever you come across a bier you should stand up, and he who follows it should not sit down till it is placed on the ground.

englishNarrator: It is narrated on the authority of Jabir ibn 'Abdullah رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: There passed a bier and the Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) stood up for it and we also stood up along with him. We said: Messenger of Allah, that was the bier of a Jewess. Upon this he remarked: Verily, death is a matter of consternation, so whenever you come across a bier stand up.

englishNarrator: Ibn Juraij told me that Abu Zubair heard Jabir رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ say:
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) kept standing for a bier until it disappeared.

englishNarrator: Abu Zubair heard Jabir رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ say:
hadithEnglish: The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and his Companions kept standing for a bier of a Jew until it disappeared from sight.
